title: (x) Chicago script - Dream Lover {Ignacio}
content:
Any ideas on the script used on this design. Sorry it’s a bit small, only reference I can find, it’s also used on the posters for Chicago on the underground system in London.

Cheers  
Rob

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [script.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109060928/http:/typophile.com/files/script_0.jpg) | 30.39 KB |

 [‹ iPod font Question](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109060928/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28354 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Climbing roses" script in Martha Stewart living - Welo Script (The Font Bureau, Inc.) {Benjamin} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109060928/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12490 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Rob Sutton

comments.content: This is contemporary, right? Made to look vintage?

Yes, that’s what they’ve done, and very well.

I have hunted through my Script Guide and several of the books I have and I can’t find this script (not even among photo-lettering scripts). It seems closest to [House Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109060928/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=23&subpage=viewfonts) from the Sign Painter package.

You might expect it to be in some of the Bluemlein Scripts that Alejandro Paul has been reviving for Veer, but it’s not any that I have collected, as far as I can tell.

- Mike Yanega

Yeah I did look on Veer as I know they have a large number of scripts. It is truly stunning when you see it up large. The design was created by a company called SpotCo in NYC guess I could email them, probably had it commissioned.

Thanks for your help

Rob

That is a “top spot”....very much impressed and appreciated....many thanks.

Rob

I appreciate finding out about that site. There are some fonts there for a number of my Guides. I wonder if they would be willing to make some samples...

Thanks for pointing the way Ignacio.

- Mike Yanega
